Constructs a new {{tt|time_point}} from one of several optional data sources.

@1@ Default constructor, creates a {{tt|time_point}} representing the {{tt|Clock}}'s epoch (i.e., {{lc|time_since_epoch()}} is zero).

@2@ Constructs a {{tt|time_point}} at {{tt|Clock}}'s epoch plus {{c|d}}.

@3@ Constructs a {{tt|time_point}} by converting {{c|t}} to {{tt|duration}}. This constructor only participates in overload resolution if {{tt|Duration2}} is implicitly convertible to {{tt|duration}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|d|a {{tt|duration}} to copy from}}
{{par|t|a {{tt|time_point}} to convert from}}
{{par end}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

using Clock = std::chrono::steady_clock;
using TimePoint = std::chrono::time_point&lt;Clock&gt;;

void print_ms(const TimePoint&amp; point) 
{
    using Ms = std::chrono::milliseconds;
    const Clock::duration since_epoch = point.time_since_epoch();
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::chrono::duration_cast&lt;Ms&gt;(since_epoch) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}

int main() 
{
    const TimePoint default_value = TimePoint(); // (1)
    print_ms(default_value); // 0ms

    const Clock::duration duration_4_seconds = std::chrono::seconds(4);
    const TimePoint time_point_4_seconds(duration_4_seconds); // (2)
    // 4 seconds from start of epoch
    print_ms(time_point_4_seconds); // 4000ms

    const TimePoint time_point_now = Clock::now(); // (3)
    print_ms(time_point_now); // 212178842ms
}
|p=true
|output=
0ms
4000ms
212178842ms
}}
